Package com.hula.lang.commands.core

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Call
    Allows a Hula script to call another script.
    Comment
    Used by the HulaParser to ensure the original Hula comments are retained in the resulting BeanShell script.
    Echo
    The Echo command writes a message to the log.
    Else
    The Else command is used to nest Commands which will be executed when no other conditional command has evaluated true.
    ElseIf
    The ElseIf command evaluates a boolean expression to decide whether its body will be executed.
    End
    The End command is used to explicitly terminate a nested Command section.
    If
    The If command evaluates a boolean expression to decide whether its body will be executed.
    Loop
    The Loop command will iterate through a list of items.
    OnFail
    The OnFail command is used to handle failures elsewhere in a Hula script.
    Pause
    The Pause command waits for a specified number of seconds.
    Quit
    The Quit command terminates the script immediately, to return control to the container.
    Return
    The Return command terminates the script immediately, to return control to the calling script (if any).
    Set
    The Set command assigns a variable value.
    Skip
    The Skip command is used as part of the Loop command to move immediately to the next list item.
    Try
    Used by the OnFail command to begin a failure handling block.
